answers.answer: Could be an ulcer, acid reflux or even gallbladder, and pain? have you had any tests?

This happens to me on occasion.  I have GERD and IBS both, but I also have a chronic migraine condition.  Sometimes I'm getting hit with a migraine and simply can't eat, so if you've ever been diagnosed with migraines, the migraines would do it, too.
It could be several things -GERDindigestionGallbladder diseaseGastritissometimes diabetes due to increase or decrease in sugar levels.

question: get very nauseated after eating with no vomiting
title: get nauseated after eating. no vomiting
